title: 107_hr4155
content: The Act titled "District of Columbia Legislative Autonomy Act of 2002" eliminates congressional review of newly-passed District laws. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to remove congressional resolutions of disapproval and exercise rulemaking power. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to remove congressional resolutions of disapproval and exercise rulemaking power, with recognition of the constitutional right of either House to change rules relating to such House at any time. SEC. 3. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended in various sections, including changes to subsections and striking certain sentences. Payments for revenue anticipation notes are also addressed in the amendments. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended in various sections, including changes to subsections and striking certain sentences related to revenue anticipation notes and initiative and referendum laws. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended by striking certain sentences in subsections related to revenue anticipation notes and initiative and referendum laws. The amendments made by this Act, effective from October 1, 2002, apply to acts of the District of Columbia passed by the Council and signed by the Mayor, vetoed by the Mayor and repassed by the Council, passed by the Council and allowed to become effective without the Mayor's signature, or ratified by a majority of registered qualified electors voting on the initiative or referendum.
